jcr:content.jcr:title: Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop

contentheadline.headline: Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox book | name = The Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop | title_orig = | translator = | image = [[File:The-encyclopedia-of-australian-rock-and-pop-cover.jpg|200px|Cover]] | caption = | author = [[Ian McFarlane]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = [[Australia]] | language = [[English language|English]] | series = | subject = Australian rock music history | genre = | publisher = Allen & Unwin | pub_date = December 1999 | english_pub_date = | media_type = | pages = 717 | isbn = 1-86508-072-1 | dewey= 781.66/0994/03 21 | congress= ML102.R6 M38 1999 | oclc = 59566131 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop''''' or '''''Rock and Pop''''' by Australian [[music journalism|music journalist]] [[Ian McFarlane]] is a guide to [[Music of Australia#Popular music|Australian popular music]] from the 1950s to the late 1990s.<ref name="NLA">{{cite web|url=http://catalogue.nla.gov.au/Search/Home?lookfor=author:%22McFarlane,%20Ian,%201959-%22&iknowwhatimean=1|title=McFarlane, Ian, 1959– |publisher=[[National Library of Australia]]|accessdate=2008-11-29}}</ref><ref name="AllenUnwin">{{cite web|url=http://www.allenandunwin.com/default.aspx?page=94&book=9781864487688|title=''The Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop''|publisher=[[Allen & Unwin]]|year=1999|month=December|accessdate=2008-11-30 }}</ref> The encyclopedia was described in ''Australian Music Guide'' as "the most exhaustive and wide-ranging encyclopedia of Australian music from the 1950s onwards".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.themusic.com.au/sxsw/pdf/amg/2004/amg_books.pdf|format=[[Portable document format|PDF]]|title=Australian Music Books|publisher=''Australian Music Guide''|year=2004|month=March |page=4|accessdate=2008-11-29}}</ref> The encyclopedia is out of print, but was for a time available on the whammo.com.au online record store, and is still in the [[Internet Archive]]. ==Reviews== Publishers, [[Allen & Unwin]] describe McFarlane's encyclopedia as containing over 870 entries and is an "essential reference to the bands and artists who molded the shape of Australian popular music [...] in an A-to-Z encyclopedia format complete with biographical and historical details. Each entry also includes listings of original band lineups and subsequent changes, record releases, career highlights, and cross-references with related bands and artists."<ref name="BarnesNoble">{{cite web|url=http://search.barnesandnoble.com/booksearch/isbnInquiry.asp?r=1&EAN=9781864487688&afsrc=1|title=The Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop, Ian McFarlane, Book|publisher=Barnes & Noble|accessdate=31 May 2009}}</ref> United States [[Barnes & Noble]] reviewer, David Turkalo, found that although it was written solidly and had "a surprising number of Australian-American connections", it was too specialised for general American library patrons.<ref name="BarnesNoble2">{{cite web|url=http://search.barnesandnoble.com/booksearch/isbnInquiry.asp?r=1&EAN=9781864487688&afsrc=1|title=The Encyclopedia of Australian Rock and Pop, Ian McFarlane, Book|last=Turkalo|first=David M.|publisher=Barnes & Noble|accessdate=31 May 2009}}</ref> The book has a similar title to the 1978 work by Noel McGrath, ''Australian Encyclopaedia of Rock and Pop''.<ref name="McGrath">{{cite book|url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.cat-vn2600148|title=Noel McGrath's Australian encyclopaedia of rock & pop / Noel McGrath|publisher=National Library of Australia|isbn=0-7270-1909-0|accessdate=31 May 2009}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://web.archive.org/web/*/http://www.whammo.com.au/encyclopediaList.asp Online version of the book as stored at the Internet Archive]<!-- NOTE: The stored copy has limited functionality. --> [[Category:Books about Australian music]] [[Category:Encyclopedias of music]] [[Category:National encyclopedias|Australia]]
